Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2012 04:47AM janiceg415 wrote: It sure interests me how each situation or doctor is different in letting us shower after surgery.  I had uniMX on Feb 23 and was told at my 1 week followup that I could shower with the 2 drains still in.  I am not sure if he saw that everything was healing nicely and that is what made the difference.  Of course showering was not the easiest with the drains.  I took an old roomy Tshirt and cut it down the front, then I slipped into it and pinned the drains onto the Tshirt.  I didn't want the drains to accidently slip out of my hands, as that would be an OUCH.   At least with the T shirt on it gave me some security, and was an easy fix then of course I just washed it with the towels until the next time.  When the drains were removed it was so quick & painless that I didn't even know they were out.  Just take advantage of your rest time and get that sleep you need to heal.  I am back to work full time and am doing well.  It gets better and better.  Going today for my 3rd fill for my tissue expander.
